## Background

Executives describe a budgeting season defined by caution: push critical bets forward, push nice-to-have projects back. Capital continues to flow toward durable cash generators while experimental projects face higher bars for approval. Several companies are rewriting service-level agreements to align incentives around uptime rather than raw volume. The biggest open question is consumer stamina—early indicators suggest restraint, not retreat.
